name: Masaya Oya
description:
{{nihongo|'''Masaya Oya'''|大箭将也|Ōya Masaya|born September 28, 1992|lead=yes}}, known professionally as {{nihongo|'''Camellia'''|かめりあ|Kameria|lead=yes}}, is a Japanese [[Electronic dance music|electronic]] musician and record producer. He is best known for his work in the [[rhythm game]] scene and has been a composer for games such as ''[[Osu!]]'', ''[[Beat Saber]]'', ''[[Sound Voltex]]'', ''[[Hatsune Miku: Project Diva]]'' and ''[[Beatmania IIDX]]''. Outside rhythm games, he has worked with the record label [[Pony Canyon]] and is a member of the label [[Exit Tunes]]. He also publishes his discography under his [[independent record label]], KamelCamellia.

Oya primarily composes fast-paced [[Electronic dance music|EDM]] songs that are usually at or above the 200 [[Tempo|BPM]] mark. His music is described as [[dubstep]], [[Trance music|trance]], [[drum and bass]], [[Hardcore (electronic dance music genre)|hardcore]], [[gabber]], [[Trap music|trap]], [[speedcore]] and [[doujin music|{{tlit|ja|doujin}} music]]. Théo Forey notes in Oya's artistry that unlike many electronic artists who focus on a single style, he actively experiments with different sounds. He often collaborates and even releases some albums alongside the singer Nanahira. He is known for his remixes of the OST of the game ''[[Undertale]]'' and collaborations with game designer and composer [[Toby Fox]]. Oya is also known for his track "Ghost", considered as the hardest in the game ''Beat Saber''. He is popular outside of Japan through the video game ''[[osu!]]'', where he has a dedicated fan community. Oya is also an active [[Video game livestreaming|streamer]] on [[Twitch (service)|Twitch]].
